body: Just like you have `append_polly_dep_if_enabled` you should be able to write a `POLLY_DEFINES_IF_ENABLED` which will expand to `"ENABLE_POLLY"` if polly is enabled (and empty string otherwise).  You can then use `defines` (https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/be/c-cpp.html#cc_library.defines) to pass this in to the `"compiler_functor"` build rule.
body_html: Just like you have append_polly_dep_if_enabled you should be able to write a POLLY_DEFINES_IF_ENABLED which will expand to "ENABLE_POLLY" if polly is enabled (and empty string otherwise). You can then use defines (https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/be/c-cpp.html#cc_library.defines) to pass this in to the "compiler_functor" build rule.
body_text: Just like you have append_polly_dep_if_enabled you should be able to write a POLLY_DEFINES_IF_ENABLED which will expand to "ENABLE_POLLY" if polly is enabled (and empty string otherwise).  You can then use defines (https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/be/c-cpp.html#cc_library.defines) to pass this in to the "compiler_functor" build rule.
